avdta.sav

Class SAVSimulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • avdta.network.Network
      • avdta.network.Simulator
        • avdta.sav.SAVSimulator

  • public class SAVSimulator
extends Simulator
    This class extends Simulator to handle the simulation of travelers and taxis. Along with SAVOrigin, SAVDest, and Traveler, the movement of travelers out of taxis, and the movement of taxis through the network, is fully defined. The matching of SAVs to travelers is decided by the Dispatch. This class facilitates the dispatch by implementing traveler and vehicle behavior once their matchings and paths have been assigned. SAVSimulator relies on a Dispatch

      • resetSim

        public void resetSim()
        Resets the simulator to restart the simulation. This moves taxis to their start location (see Taxi.getStartLocation()) and registers them as a free taxi in the Dispatch. This also calls Traveler.reset().
        Overrides:
        resetSim in class Simulator

      • addVehicles

        public void addVehicles()
        Adds travelers and creates events for the Dispatch. This method is called every time step as part of Simulator.simulate(). Every Simulator.ast_duration, this calls Dispatch.updateShortestPaths(). Travelers departing at the specified time will be added to the appropriate origin. Finally, this calls Dispatch.newTimestep().
        Overrides:
        addVehicles in class Simulator

      • getTSTT

        public double getTSTT()
        Returns the total system travel time. This method iterates over all vehicles, and sums their travel time (see Vehicle.getTT()).
        Overrides:
        getTSTT in class Simulator
        Returns:
        the total system travel time(s)

      • getAvgTT

        public double getAvgTT()

        Returns:
        the average travel time (s)

      • addTravelerToTaxi

        public void addTravelerToTaxi(Taxi taxi,
                              Traveler person)
        This adds the traveler to the taxi, and should be called by the Dispatch to handle all simulator updates associated with a traveler entering a taxi. This should only be called when the taxi and the traveler are at the same location (the same SAVOrigin). This calls Dispatch.travelerDeparted(avdta.sav.Taxi, avdta.sav.Traveler) to notify the Dispatch and Traveler.enteredTaxi(). This also causes the taxi to dwell at its location for Taxi.DELAY_ENTER seconds.
        Parameters:
        taxi - the taxi
        person - the traveler

      • getTaxis

        public java.util.List<Taxi> getTaxis()

        a list of all taxis

        public boolean isSimulationFinished()
        Checks whether the simulation has finished. This requires that all travelers have exited.
